Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the conditions of workers in Malaysia by using the term "slave-like conditions."
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that "many of the workers are indentured servants."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that workers in Malaysia have their passports taken away when they enter the country, which may not be true for all workers.
Exist alternative explanation: While the claim attributes the workers' conditions solely to being indentured servants, there may be other factors contributing to their situation.
